alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern and central Caroline County in Maryland. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated minor flooding along the upper Choptank River and it tributaries. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain fell during the night. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Denton, Greensboro, and Goldsboro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
